STRATEGY.objection_type: EXTERNAL - Price/Value justification for HIGH-TICKET items
STRATEGY.contrast: Micro Features handle practical concerns LOGISTICALLY in the Grid
STRATEGY.HIGH_TICKET_PIVOT: For $300+ items, 'Easy Returns' is table stakes. The REAL objection is Value/Guilt.

the_secret.meaning: Why this isn't an expense - it's an INVESTMENT
the_secret.philosophical_angle: Reframe from 'spending money' to 'building an asset class wardrobe'

HIGH_TICKET_OBJECTIONS.surface_objection: It's expensive / I can't justify this
HIGH_TICKET_OBJECTIONS.real_objection: Value/Guilt - Will I regret this? Is this irresponsible?
HIGH_TICKET_OBJECTIONS.REAL_STRATEGY: Validate the FINANCIAL decision, not just remove logistics

ASSET_CLASS_WARDROBE_FRAMEWORK.concept: Position clothing as an ASSET, not an EXPENSE

cost_per_wear.example: That $40 top you wore twice? $20/wear. This at $400 worn weekly for 4 years? Under $2/wear.

resale_value.what: Quality pieces hold or increase in value
resale_value.example: Check Poshmark. Quality pieces resell for 40-60% of retail. Fast fashion? You can't give it away.

rental_potential.what: She could literally rent this out
rental_potential.example: Women are renting out quality pieces on Tulerie and making back their investment. Your closet is an asset.

girl_math.what: Use the language she already uses to justify purchases
girl_math.example: Girl math says: if you return that other thing you were going to buy anyway, this is basically free.

opportunity_cost.what: What she's LOSING by buying cheap
opportunity_cost.example: You'll buy 5 cheap versions that disappoint before you finally buy the one that works. Save the heartache.

E_cognitive_disruption.what: Challenge the belief that expensive = irresponsible
E_cognitive_disruption.example: What if I told you the most expensive clothes in your closet are the cheap ones?

N_unfinished_story.what: Tell a story about the TRUE cost of cheap fashion
N_unfinished_story.example: I added up every 'affordable' piece I bought last year. $1,200. Wears I got out of them? Maybe 30. Then I bought ONE quality piece...

G_controversial_truth.what: Reveal the REAL economics of fashion
G_controversial_truth.example: Here's the math no fast fashion brand wants you to do: A $40 top worn twice = $20/wear. A $400 piece worn 200 times = $2/wear. Cheap is expensive.

A_personal_stakes.example: I was tired of feeling guilty every time I bought something nice, then guilty again when the cheap stuff fell apart. Now I invest in pieces that earn their place.

G_unconventional_payoff.example: This isn't just a piece you own. It's a piece you could resell for half what you paid. It's wardrobe equity. Fashion that appreciates.

E_time_locked_curiosity.what: Create urgency around the SMART financial decision
E_time_locked_curiosity.example: The women who get this? They're building closets that work as hard as they do. Stop renting your style from fast fashion. Start owning it.

images.NOT: testimonial images (those are for Micro Features)
